intro: Heteranthemis hirta, commonly known as the hairy heteranthemis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from pink to purple, attracting various pollinators. The hairy texture of its leaves and stems is a distinguishing feature, providing it with some protection against herbivores and excessive sunlight.
